data.text:
この前のNHKスペシャルの昭和天皇の「拝謁記」

WSJでもう記事になっていた。

Nスぺでは戦争全般に関しての昭和天皇のお考えが伺い知れたけど、国際的に報道する時は南京事件が全面に出されるのね。 https://t.co/pojRscvdaQ

data.text: If you don't know about the Nanjing massacre, prepare to be horrified beyond belief.  To be killed would have been a relief to many of the people who were mutilated and tortured. https://t.co/Wzs28PDwRz

text: If you don't know about the Nanjing massacre, prepare to be horrified beyond belief.  To be killed would have been a relief to many of the people who were mutilated and tortured. https://t.co/Wzs28PDwRz

data.text: According to Mr. Tajima’s notes, Hirohito said he had “heard vaguely” through unofficial sources “that horrible things were done at Nanjing, but no one spoke about it openly and I didn’t pay attention. But if one looks at the facts that became public at the trial in Ichigaya” https://t.co/B5MXL46SY5

text: According to Mr. Tajima’s notes, Hirohito said he had “heard vaguely” through unofficial sources “that horrible things were done at Nanjing, but no one spoke about it openly and I didn’t pay attention. But if one looks at the facts that became public at the trial in Ichigaya” https://t.co/B5MXL46SY5
